results.title: Borgo a Mozzano
results.creator_credit: Michele Gandin, Shell Film Unit and Report Films
results.brief_description: During the last three thousand years the commune of Borgo a Mozzano in Tuscany has often been touched by history but somehow, now, it has stopped growing. As an experiment in raising the standard of living an agronomist was called in. But peasants are conservative and it takes time to win them over, but at last this was done and a new way of life began to unfold.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michele Gandin, Shell Film Unit and Report Films

results.title: Borderline
results.creator_credit: Fergus McDonell, Grant McLean and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A story of conflict and rebellion in a teenage girl that, to a large degree, typifies the problems of emotional adjustment experienced by many adolescents in their striving towards maturity. We meet Nora Fenton, a disturbed 15-year-old girl who, because of her persistent defiance of parental authority and self-injurious behavior, is sent to a remedial home for problem adolescents. As the film reviews Nora’s problems, we see how understanding, affection and firm parental guidance are th factors most needed in helping teenagers weather their most turbulent years.

results.title: Border weave
results.creator_credit: Turner Film Productions and John Curthoys
results.brief_description: This is a study of Scotland’s woollen industry, and, in particular, the weaving of the famous rainbow-hued Border cloth. From all over the world comes wool for Border looms to manufacture into the finest woollen cloth in the world. This film shows the processes in detail, from the preliminary grading and scouring of the wool, the careful blending of the brilliant colors for dyeing and the spinning of the yarn.

results.title: Border town = Bian cheng [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Ling Zifeng and Beijing Film Studio
results.brief_description: This bittersweet drama set in the first half of the twentieth century is adapted from the novel of the same name by noted Chinese writer Shen Congwen. The story centres on Cuicui, a feisty teenager orphaned as a young girl who lives and works with her ferryman grandfather in a small village in West Hunan province. Over a period of time two brothers, the sons of a local ship-owner, are each drawn to Cuicui, who despite her grandfather’s concerns about her future, stubbornly rejects any notion of courtship or marriage. When tragedy, caused in part by the girls inaction, befalls those around her, she is left alone. Cast includes Feng Hanyuan, Dai Na, Liu Kui and Shi Lei. (Awards: Best director Golden Rooster Awards, 1985). In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Border images: Albury-Wodonga 1920s-1970s
results.creator_credit: National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: Recapture the essence of Albury-Wodonga, the twin border cities on the Murray River. Delight in the landscapes of the past, recall the unique growth and progress of these twin cities: Hume Weir construction ; the intrigue of the Pyjama Murder mystery, travel on the Spirit of Progresses inaugural journey ; race in the 1930 Albury Gold Cup ; fly the Centenary Air Race with Bert Hinkler ; laugh with the old times of Albury-Wodonga and follow the frolicking fun of days gone by.
results.creator_credit_for_label: National Film and Sound Archive of Australia

results.title: Border country
results.creator_credit: Peter Thompson, Jill Robb, South Australian Film Corporation and Trojan Films
results.brief_description: A cinematic exploration of South Eastern South Australia, a region that combines the wild beauty of The Coorong with lush grazing properties, pine forests, Mt Gambier’s famous Blue Lake, and the quiet charm of small fishing villages.

results.title: Boppo's bike ride
results.creator_credit: South West Institute of TAFE, Allan Parker, Yaraan Bundle and Ivan Couzens
results.brief_description:
A grandfather/grandaughter collaboration, this is one man’s journey through place and time from the 1930s-1960s. Ivan Couzens reminisces about the days when riding a bike was the only way to get around; school was a five mile ride away; and when he started work at the Bluestone quarries, the bicycle was his only mode of transport. A light-hearted look at the past interspersed with photographs and images of places once travelled. Music: “Greenflower” by Rob Bundle.
Created as part of the “Bute Utes the Movie” project in association with Regional Arts Victoria.

results.title: Bophana
results.brief_description: Bophana Audiovisual Resource Center in Cambodia is dedicated to the collection, digitisation and preservation of media lost during the Khmer Rouge reign, including newsreels, features, records, documentaries and photos.

constellations_primary.name: Bophana: cultural memory on film
constellations_primary.description: Bophana Audiovisual Resource Center is dedicated to the collection, preservation and presentation of audiovisual material related to Cambodia. Their collection includes archival footage, newsreels, documentaries, feature films, photographs and vinyl records.

results.description:
Bophana Audiovisual Resource Center in Cambodia is dedicated to the collection, digitisation and preservation of media lost during the Khmer Rouge reign, including newsreels, features, records, documentaries and photos. The 1960s and early 70s were a golden age for Cambodian cinema. The thriving film industry produced over 300 films and cinemas dotted the country alongside a vibrant music scene and traditional ballet. When the Khmer Rouge took over in 1975, artists were targeted and a key aspect of Cambodia’s cultural heritage was dismantled. Safeguarding this material is essential for reconstructing Cambodia’s cultural memory, allowing for new interpretations of historical footage and giving agency back to the community.

An institutional partnership between ACMI, Bophana and Cambodian Living Arts is supported by the Australian Government through the Australia-ASEAN Council of the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade
description_for_label:
Bophana Audiovisual Resource Center in Cambodia is dedicated to the collection, digitisation and preservation of media lost during the Khmer Rouge reign, including newsreels, features, records, documentaries and photos. The 1960s and early 70s were a golden age for Cambodian cinema. The thriving film industry produced over 300 films and cinemas dotted the country alongside a vibrant music scene and traditional ballet. When the Khmer Rouge took over in 1975, artists were targeted and a key aspect of Cambodia’s cultural heritage was dismantled. Safeguarding this material is essential for reconstructing Cambodia’s cultural memory, allowing for new interpretations of historical footage and giving agency back to the community.

An institutional partnership between ACMI, Bophana and Cambodian Living Arts is supported by the Australian Government through the Australia-ASEAN Council of the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade

results.title: Bootmen [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Dein Perry, Hilary Linstead and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Loosely based on director Dein Perry’s early life as a dancer, “Bootmen” is the story of two brothers - Sean (Adam Garcia) and Mitchell (Sam Worthington) - working in a steel mill in the industrial city of Newcastle. Both dream of one day escaping from the mill, Sean as a tap dancer in Sydney and Mitchell purchasing a tow truck to get out of the only life their stern father has ever known. Tension arrises between the brothers when Sean quits the mill to go to Sydney to study with a well known dance troupe and Mitchell moves in on Sean’s woman, Linda (Sophie Lee), both brothers finding themselves in love with her. “Bootmen” is a feel-good movie that is similar in genre to “Strictly Ballroom” and “The Full Monty”, a touching and sweet film with wonderful tap dancing sequences. Cast also includes William Zappa, Richard Carter and Susie Porter.
